review_blob: Had it once 13 years ago in Copenhagen.  Very fond memory of a nice head, and smooth malt taste.  Never seen it in the US.  Would buy it in a heartbeat if I did.

I was so excited on my first trip to Prague.  The waiter asked for what I want to drink & I ask what they have.. "All we have is Budweiser" he says.  My heart sank, but quickly recovered when he meant the Czech variant.  
Overall I'm think it's a very good beer, but not a world record in my opinion.  Plenty smooth, aromatic, and flavorful, but the aftertaste is marginal.

I was at an 'after business function' at the bar in the Ypsi Marriot when I tried this brew.  What a surprise.  I normally don't have high expectations of flavor in that setting but the great smooth hoppy flavor is something I remember fondly.
It looks like a typical american beer, but tastes much worse.  The aftertaste is most unpleasant for me.  My only appreciation for this brew is of the commercials!
Don't give me flak... my friends already do over this.  I'll take this over the other mass-produced american beers from AB, Miller, or Coors anyday, and it's on the way cheap side to boot.
This is my favorite beer, although I haven't had it since Goose Island took it over.  Sure wish they'd get a distribution agreement for michigan.
